title: riven's shield ratio should be halfed
body: and made so that she gets the rest of her shield if she attacks a champion

replies.body: Riven should have mana or evergy so she not so op

They nerfed her then made her able to wall jump anything lol Riot are funny. If she doesn't get shut down in lane she is useful but being CC'd during her combos really shuts her down and there are a lot of CC's that she's not mobile enough to dodge although I must say her being able to jump most walls does add to her power however her HP regen was reduced to nothing so her Shield is really all she has going for her and if you can out-trade her with an early sustainer like Vladimir or poke her with Kennen or Pantheon and play safe she can't farm that much and her shield scaling wont really be that great as a result - most of her AD items have been nerfed or changed so they don't benefit her that much and she isn't that strong with double bruiser comps as opposed to with tank junglers so you usually don't have to worry about other Champs taken armor shred in which case she can build a relatively early Last Whisper and will deal tons of AOE damage in team fights.

She excels at 3v1's - keep this in mind when picking against her because disengage Champions deal better against her than heavy engagers do in most cases.

>  if you can out-trade her with an early sustainer like Vladimir or poke her with Kennen

You have no idea what you're talking about if you think Vladimir does anything but terrible against Riven. Kennen does decently due to the stuns but neither of these champions facerape Riven. Play people who out-burst with CC. Pantheon/Darius/Jax(debateable) .

I dunk on every Darius I verse even though he can counter her hit and run playstyle, can do literally nothing against Kennen's poke and Vladimir is a strong sustainer and can pool her combo's or engages making her gain minion aggro while he loses it and this makes her lane push so she is vulnerable to jungle ganks.

Vladimir in the early levels before level 7 is anything but a strong sustainer. He is basically just there as a presence to not lose lane whilst the riven rampages around the lane stomping anything in her path. 
Riven is always vulnerable to ganks because she spends the entire time going all in though, you're correct. But with a vlad as the laner the kill pressure drops by a lot.

>Riven is always vulnerable to ganks because she spends the entire time going all in though,

Well, the same abilities that she uses to go all in are the same abilities that she uses to escape a gank relatively easily if played right. They are in a low cooldown once the game starts to get going, about a few minutes in.

There's no such thing as shutting down a Riven for the match. Unless the Riven is really horrendous she will keep disengaging when her combos keep failing and return to hit you with her giant ass sword every time you make one misstep as any champion save the super tanks. 

She's been the most broken champion in the game for a while now. 
There's no stopping a Riven from not dying once she's got two kills for her items.
Play Annie or Morgana and stop her right in her tracks :^)

stfu all you Riven haters. You think she is op because you verse smurferinos. She is balanced. At a higher elo you would understand this. If she was op boxbox would be challenger 1. If you think it's a skill less champ then go play with her :^). She is actually hard to play and the nerfs that have hit her has made her extremely balanced and her laning is nowhere near as stompy as before. It's still snowbally but it requires the enemy to make mistakes.
what mistakes? qw aa qq aa e off. You haven't got the armor for that your usually dead or pretty close
I think they should reduce her ad ratio on her shield by 50% but increase the duration by 50%. Would be so much more balanced
not sure if its a nerf or not. because the longer lasting shield would make her a bit more viable to clear jungle creeps

At lv 1 her shield in the jg would absorb a wave of attack from minions, but if its ratio is decreased she will take more damage from the creeps, her e atm is broken because it can block the burst on most assassins because of its large scale, decreasing the scale and increasing the duration would make her have to play a bit more cautiously, she cant block a full on assault as easily, right now her shield at rank 5 with 300 bonus ad is about 510 for 1.5 sec blocking a majority of the burst in combo champions. But if you reduce the scale by 50% and increase the duration by 25%-50% it would be 350 shield and around a  1.85-2.225 sec duration. Allowing people to actually hurt her. (most riven end up around 700 shield if they build properly, this would be reduced to around 455) Either that or thy could reduce her q scaling to 35% ad instead of 60% bonus leaving you with a nice 105% ad instead of 180% bonus ad. Or. Just halve the base stats on her q and e.

Again the only real disadvantage I can see to playing riven is that she loses damage in order to gapclose and is relatively squishy. her ult and some CDR render the first part useless and 1 defensive item + shield + cc is usually all the defence riven needs.
Yes, but there is still an 'incentive' to use abilities because of her passive AA buff.
not really riven has no drawback to being manaless, as well as high damage/mobility cc and waveclear. I would not mind all this if there weren't clear weaknesses.
Do you play Riven? No. She is easily out-traded and out-damaged. Her waveclear requires her to melee the creeps. She cant tank a creepwave without BT or hydra/tiamat.
Guess you never played her before she got her numbers adjusted.
